intro: Xanthophyllum wrayi, commonly known as the yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slight pubescence, while the stems are erect and somewhat woody. Xanthophyllum wrayi is valued not only for its ornamental beauty but also for its ecological role in supporting local pollinators.
